bibl.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Subpoena
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, Third Judicial District.

In the name of the United States of America, You are hereby commanded to be and appear at the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, at Seattle, for the District aforesaid, at 3 o'clock in the afternoon of the 22nd day of Nov A.D. 1888 then and there to give evidence in a certain cause therein pending, wherein Louis Brown is applicant for Habeas Corpus and bring with you all books papers and record in case of City of Seattle vs Louis Brown and to remain in attendance on said Court from day to day thereafter until discharged, and herein fail not at your peril. Plaintiff and Defendant
Witness, The HON. Richard A. Jones, Chas. E. BoyleChief Justice of the Supreme
Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said District Court, this 22nd day of Nov 1888 W.E. Ledgerwood
In the District Court, holding terms at Seattle, Washington Terr.
In the matter of the application of Louis Brown for writ of Habeas Corpus
Territory of Washington, }ss. County of King

I Hereby Certify that I received the within Subpoena on the 22nd day of November A.D. 1888 and personally served the same on N. Soderberg by reading the same to each of them, in King County, Washington Territory, on the 22nd day of Nov. A.D. 1888
Dated King County, W.T. Nov 22 A.D. 1888
William Cochrane Sheriff of King County
